column4: i am trying to install ntfs for linux by paragon and i'm getting this error:Can't find compiled modules for kernel 2.6.15.7-ubuntu1 - Can't find compiled modules for kernel. Please, compile your kernel and run this program again. anyone know what the problem is and how to solve it please?
can anyone help me with my problem?
pretty please!
can anyone pls help me??

i am trying to install ntfs for linux by paragon and i'm getting this error:Can't find compiled modules for kernel 2.6.15.7-ubuntu1 - Can't find compiled modules for kernel. Please, compile your kernel and run this program again. anyone know what the problem is and how to solve it please?

i am trying to install ntfs for linux by paragon and i'm getting this error:Can't find compiled modules for kernel 2.6.15.7-ubuntu1 - Can't find compiled modules for kernel. Please, compile your kernel and run this program again. anyone know what the problem is and how to solve it please?
can someone PLEASE help me????
what does this mean and how to fix it?? : Can't find compiled modules for kernel. Please, compile your kernel and run this program again.
where r the compiled kernel modles?
all u guys r too busy for me :(
are you trying to install via APT/synaptic?
why?  There are free programs to do that that you can get without compiling
yeah but i heard they r all unstable
I wouldn't trust a product just because someone is selling it.  I've heard they're not *that* unstable.  Let me find you the howto...
i did try it and i couldn't delete files that were created by windows!!!!! it kept saying file not found
honestly, ANY ntfs writing on Linux is going to be risky because MS hasn't released the spec.  You take a chance either way.
read through this thread : http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=142481
yeah but that didn't work for me - whereas the bootable disk that paragon gave as a trial did work
yeah that's the howto i tried
btw thanks for ur help - i appreciate it
the thing is when i did that howto, it mounted ok, but the blasted thing wouldn't delete any files previously created by windows - it keps saying no such file or dir

well, I'd post your problems there if you haven't.  There aren't many on Linux who will use paid software for ntfs and thus not many who can help you.  The short of it is that your issue is a dependency problem, and since you're compiling the paragon program doesn't come with the right dependencies (nor would you really want to install them -- it looks like it's requiring an older kernel version than you probably have)
